brunch1.description:
Sunday brunch with friends from Felix's preschools, past and present.

Clockwise, starting with the back row: Torin, Felix, Kora, Phoebe, Owen, Sarah.

Kora and Torin used to go to the Snuggery, but they just switched to the New School.
brunch1.title: Brunch 1

brunch2.description: <u>Clockwise, from back left</u>:  Laura, Cindee, Mark, Katie with son Owen, Chris, Perry.
brunch2.title: Brunch 2

brunch3.description:
We had kids running everywhere. At times, they even played calmly in Felix's room.

Kora, Phoebe and Felix put together a puppet show (note the closed shutters: they are not ready for the show to start yet).
brunch3.title: Brunch 3

brunch4.description: On the other side of the shutters, the audience can hardly wait.
brunch4.title: Brunch 4

brunch4b.description: The show starts.  Kora masterfully directs the action. Something about a princess riding a horse. I didn't catch all the details.
brunch4b.title: Brunch4b

brunch5.description: This is Owen.  He and Felix are school buddies and we've had a few play dates.  They have similar temperaments.
brunch5.title: Brunch 5

brunch6.description: No room in the house was left unexplored. Sarah and Torin really liked our selection of bath toys. Sarah even convinced her mom to give her a bath during the party!
brunch6.title: Brunch 6

brunch7.description: Dean and Phoebe mix it up.
brunch7.title: Brunch 7

brunch8.description: All our younger guests loved Dean.  He chased them tirelessly around the house and through the garden, over and over again.
brunch8.title: Brunch 8

brunch9.description: Kora wants to know if there is room for one more.
brunch9.title: Brunch 9

stroller.description: Play date with Torin.  Our double stroller converted into a triple.  Milo never quite slipped out.
stroller.title: Stroller

table.description: Milo is very proud of himself:  he can sit down and eat at the kid table all by himself.  Tonight when Lucie called 'à table!' he ran to seat himself here..
table.title: Table

temescal1.description: Oakland's Lake Temescal is only 20 minutes away, but we had never gone.  It's a nice place to get wet. It stays shallow for a long time, a must for the younger set.
temescal1.title: Temescal 1

temescal2.description: Lake Temescal's little beach is the perfect spot to dig holes, fill buckets, and come home with sand stuck where the sun don't shine.
temescal2.title: Temescal 2

description:
Felix's school re-opened for the fall semester. Going back was blissfully painless. Felix was so excited to see his friends and teachers the first day, he actually ran the entire 4 blocks to school.

Milo really likes his nanny, and Lucie is enjoying her job. Yeah! It feels good to be back in a routine.

Milo continued the language explosion that started last week. He's picking up baby signs as fast as we can teach them. He's especially into animals. He repeats a ton of suff, but here's the new ones that we've confirmed he does independently:
  • no: no. The no's have started!
  • meuuuuuuuh: cow
  • [brush cheek with 2 fingers] + meow: cat.
  • [scratch ribs] + oo oo oo: monkey.
  • [hand claws the air] + rrrraaaaaa: lion.
  • [wide clap of the hands]: crocodile.
  • [fingers open and close like a beak]: duck
  • [fist]: ball. He has a hard time doing this one, his fingers just kinda twitch.
  • [arm outstretched] + niaaaaooooo: plane.
  • [arm above head]: sun.
title: September 11
